description: Evaluation rubric for application essays across all program types

authenticity.description: Does the essay reveal the applicant's genuine voice and personality?

criteria: Distinct, unmistakable voice that could only belong to this applicant
Specific personal details and anecdotes that feel lived-in
Emotional honesty without being performative
Reader feels they've genuinely met the person
Generally authentic with personality showing through
Some specific moments that feel genuine
Voice is present but not always consistent
Reader gets a sense of who the person is
Mostly genuine but with some generic elements
Some personality present but buried under formal language
A few specific details but mostly general statements
Could apply to many applicants with minor changes
Reads like a template or heavily coached
Generic statements that could apply to anyone
Formal tone that masks personality
Feels like what applicant thinks admissions wants to hear
No discernible personality or voice
Entirely generic or clichéd content
Clearly written by someone else (parent, tutor)
Disconnected from the actual applicant

narrative_structure.description: Does the essay have a clear arc with engaging storytelling?

criteria: Compelling hook that draws reader in immediately
Clear narrative arc with tension, development, and resolution
Pacing keeps reader engaged throughout
Satisfying conclusion that resonates
Sophisticated use of literary techniques (imagery, dialogue, reflection)
Engaging opening that establishes context
Logical flow with clear beginning, middle, and end
Story moves forward with purpose
Conclusion connects back to opening or theme
Some effective use of storytelling techniques
Functional opening but not particularly grabbing
Essay flows adequately but may feel choppy
Story is present but may meander
Conclusion exists but may feel abrupt or disconnected
Basic narrative without sophisticated techniques
Weak or generic opening
Disjointed flow, hard to follow
No clear narrative arc
Conclusion missing or unsatisfying
Reads more like a list than a story
No discernible structure
Incoherent or rambling
No beginning, middle, or end
Reader is confused about the point

specificity.description: Does the essay use concrete, specific details rather than vague generalities?

criteria: Rich, vivid details that paint a clear picture
Specific names, places, dates, and sensory details
Examples are concrete and memorable
'Show don't tell' executed masterfully
Reader can visualize scenes and moments
Good use of specific examples and details
Some vivid moments that stand out
More showing than telling
Concrete examples support claims
Reader can follow and picture most scenes
Mix of specific and general content
Some concrete examples but also vague statements
Tendency to tell more than show
Details present but not always vivid
Reader gets a general sense but not a clear picture
Mostly vague and general statements
Few if any specific examples
Heavy on telling, light on showing
Abstract claims without concrete support
Reader struggles to visualize or connect
Entirely abstract or generic
No specific details whatsoever
All telling, no showing
Reads like a resume summary, not a story

insight_and_reflection.description: Does the essay demonstrate meaningful self-reflection and growth?

criteria: Deep, nuanced self-awareness
Genuine reflection on growth and change
Insight that goes beyond surface-level observations
Evidence of intellectual or emotional maturity
Clear sense of how experience shaped the person
Good self-awareness with some depth
Reflection on what was learned or how they grew
Shows some evolution in thinking
Connects experience to personal development
Demonstrates ability to learn from experiences
Some self-reflection present
Basic observations about growth
Surface-level insights
Lessons learned are stated but not deeply explored
Some connection between experience and growth
Minimal self-reflection
Observations are obvious or clichéd
No clear sense of growth or change
Lessons learned feel tacked on
Disconnect between story and supposed insight
No self-reflection or insight
No sense of growth or learning
Purely descriptive without reflection
Reader learns nothing about applicant's inner life

prompt_response.description: Does the essay directly address the prompt or question asked?

criteria: Directly and fully addresses the prompt
Creative interpretation while staying on topic
All parts of multi-part prompts addressed
Clear connection between content and question asked
Addresses the prompt well
May miss minor aspects of multi-part prompts
Clear effort to respond to what was asked
Content is relevant to the prompt
Generally addresses the prompt
Some tangential content
May miss some aspects of the prompt
Connection to prompt is present but could be stronger
Only loosely connected to the prompt
Significant portions are off-topic
Key aspects of the prompt are ignored
Feels like a recycled essay for a different prompt
Does not address the prompt at all
Completely off-topic
Wrong prompt answered
Generic essay with no connection to specific prompt

notes: Focus on enthusiasm and authenticity over polish
Parent involvement in editing is more acceptable but should not override student voice
Emerging maturity in voice (13-14 years old)

red_flags.description: Essay sounds written by a parent or professional, not the student
Overuse of clichéd phrases ('I learned so much', 'changed my life', etc.)
Essay simply restates achievements already in the application
Inappropriate topics, offensive content, or poor judgment
Significantly over or under word limit

feedback_templates.excellent: Your essay demonstrates exceptional {category}. {specific_praise}. This is exactly what admissions committees are looking for.
feedback_templates.good: Your essay shows strong {category}. {specific_praise}. To elevate it further, consider {specific_suggestion}.
feedback_templates.adequate: Your essay adequately addresses {category}, but there's room for improvement. {specific_observation}. Try {specific_suggestion}.
feedback_templates.needs_work: Your essay needs development in {category}. {specific_observation}. I recommend {specific_suggestion}.
feedback_templates.poor: Your essay requires significant revision in {category}. {specific_observation}. Start by {specific_suggestion}.
